issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: This is a regression from just a few days ago. Screenshot attached. They used to show the CPU, disk, etc.
fields.summary: launch instance wizard and LC wizard now no longer describe what the vmtypes are

comments.body: Possibly related to the changes implemented in GUI-586
[~jloza] please give more details. I see it populating just fine. How did you enter the launch instance wizard? I clicked in from the dash.
Unable to reproduce on Chrome Version 34.0.1847.116 on Mac OS 10.8.5

Seeing this consistently in LC wizard launched from LC landing page, and on launch instance launched from either the dash or the instance landing, or the image page. Just pulled from develop at 5:56 CDT.

browser is chrome Version 33.0.1750.152, and in FF 27.0.1. mac osx 10.9.2

Cleared cache to no avail.

IMPORTANT: This appears to be working OK on my QA machine, so let's sit on this for a day or so until that machine gets rebuilt from the latest develop, and be sure it doesn't appear there.

I've just seen this myself. I know I had a session timeout before that. Could be related. Logging out and back in again didn't help. Restarting the server did help. Could be that something isn't working properly with the way vmtypes are cached, so only a fresh cache pull gets you the right values?
Now that I've instrumented the code that fetches the instance types, I'm no longer seeing the error. damn you, Schrödinger

I was looking at console output from my instrumented console and saw this:
2014-04-18 16:51:07 INFO fresh instance types : [(u'm1.small', u'm1.small'), (u't1.micro', u't1.micro'), (u'm1.medium', u'm1.medium'), (u'c1.medium', u'c1.medium'), (u'm1.large', u'm1.large'), (u'm1.xlarge', u'm1.xlarge'), (u'c1.xlarge', u'c1.xlarge'), (u'm2.xlarge', u'm2.xlarge'), (u'm3.xlarge', u'm3.xlarge'), (u'm2.2xlarge', u'm2.2xlarge'), (u'm3.2xlarge', u'm3.2xlarge'), (u'cc1.4xlarge', u'cc1.4xlarge'), (u'm2.4xlarge', u'm2.4xlarge'), (u'hi1.4xlarge', u'hi1.4xlarge'), (u'cc2.8xlarge', u'cc2.8xlarge'), (u'cg1.4xlarge', u'cg1.4xlarge'), (u'cr1.8xlarge', u'cr1.8xlarge'), (u'hs1.8xlarge', u'hs1.8xlarge')]
2014-04-18 16:51:07 INFO cached instance types : [(u'm1.small', u'm1.small'), (u't1.micro', u't1.micro'), (u'm1.medium', u'm1.medium'), (u'c1.medium', u'c1.medium'), (u'm1.large', u'm1.large'), (u'm1.xlarge', u'm1.xlarge'), (u'c1.xlarge', u'c1.xlarge'), (u'm2.xlarge', u'm2.xlarge'), (u'm3.xlarge', u'm3.xlarge'), (u'm2.2xlarge', u'm2.2xlarge'), (u'm3.2xlarge', u'm3.2xlarge'), (u'cc1.4xlarge', u'cc1.4xlarge'), (u'm2.4xlarge', u'm2.4xlarge'), (u'hi1.4xlarge', u'hi1.4xlarge'), (u'cc2.8xlarge', u'cc2.8xlarge'), (u'cg1.4xlarge', u'cg1.4xlarge'), (u'cr1.8xlarge', u'cr1.8xlarge'), (u'hs1.8xlarge', u'hs1.8xlarge')]

This tells me that in some case, the instance types do not get the descriptions populated prior to cache insertion. I'll examine the code to try making sense of this.

There is a case where the add_description parameter is set to False where the description portion will be blank (as seen in this). The way the caching was written, that decision is being handled within the cache method, so the result is cached and re-used. I'll re-code this to cache the actual data so that versions with and without descriptions can be returned on demand from the cache.
Yay thanks for figuring this one out, [~dkavanagh]! :)

[~dkavanagh] Nice catch [~dkavanagh]!  If the add_description param was the issue, a sure-fire way to reproduce this would be to load a landing page with the instance_types filter prior to loading one of the launch wizards, as an FYI.
Exactly what I did, but thanks.

set up filter on instance type on landing page first (comments indicated this would reproduce the problem), launched instance and launch config wizards, verified VM type decriptions were displaying as expected.

Verified on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 29.0
